person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Economic Crimes - St. Kitts and Nevis

description.narrative: Provide expert consultation to the Eastern Caribbean Central Bank (ECCB) to support its supervision of the domestic banking sector in the eight countries within the Eastern Caribbean Currency Union (ECCU) that fall under its jurisdiction, to include (1) developing ECCB approach to anti-money laundering and countering the financing of terrorism (AML/CFT) supervision for institutions licensed under the Banking Act, providing for the application of consistent supervision across the eight countries under ECCB authority which vary in legal and regulatory requirements; (2) improving ECCB capacity to conduct off- and onsite AML/CFT supervision, especially in the area of the development and review of off- and onsite examination processes and tools; (3) mentoring ECCB examiners during off- and onsite AML/CFT examination of a regulated entity in St. Vincent and the Grenadines (SVG) to underscore practical implementation of processes and tools; (4) developing ECCB mechanisms to coordinate with AML/CFT stakeholders in each ECCU country; and (5) establishing ECCB AML/CFT outreach activities to regulated entities.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Economic Crimes - St. Kitts and Nevis

description.narrative: Provide expert consultation to the Eastern Caribbean Central Bank (ECCB) to support its supervision of the domestic banking sector in the eight countries within the Eastern Caribbean Currency Union (ECCU) that fall under its jurisdiction, to include (1) developing ECCB approach to anti-money laundering and countering the financing of terrorism (AML/CFT) supervision for institutions licensed under the Banking Act, providing for the application of consistent supervision across the eight countries under ECCB authority which vary in legal and regulatory requirements; (2) improving ECCB capacity to conduct off- and onsite AML/CFT supervision, especially in the area of the development and review of off- and onsite examination processes and tools; (3) mentoring ECCB examiners during off- and onsite AML/CFT examination of a regulated entity in St. Vincent and the Grenadines (SVG) to underscore practical implementation of processes and tools; (4) developing ECCB mechanisms to coordinate with AML/CFT stakeholders in each ECCU country; and (5) establishing ECCB AML/CFT outreach activities to regulated entities.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Economic Crimes -St. Kitts

description.narrative: Assist the ECCB to develop consistent AML/CFT supervision practices across the eight jurisdictions, notwithstanding varying legal frameworks and capacity; develop risk-based AML/CFT supervision practices, consistent with international standards; develop the capacity of its examiners to perform AML/CFT off- and on-site examinations applying updated supervision tools and skills; develop mechanisms to coordinate with AML/CFT stakeholders in each jurisdiction; and design and conduct outreach activities to engage the domestic banking sectors.
